description: The MS in Accounting Data Analytics and Technology program provides a unique blend of accounting, data analytics, and technology to meet the market needs for accountants and auditors with advanced data analytics skills. The accounting profession is in the midst of a technological disruption. Accounting professionals are expected to go beyond the debits and credits and become tech-savvy professionals. They should not only be skilled in accounting and auditing, but they also must have skills in data analytics and information systems that allow them to make informed decisions. This new program will provide a unique blend of accounting, data analytics, and technology to meet the new market needs for accountants and auditors with data analytics skills. This program is a STEM-designated program and is registered with the New York State Education Department for 150-credit hour-licensure.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.
Program name: Master of Science in Accounting Data Analytics and Technology

description: The Master of Business Administration in Public Accounting prepares students for entry and career advancement in the field of public accountancy by providing a course of study that satisfies the educational requirements for CPA licensure in New York State. While it is geared to the CPA candidate who lacks an undergraduate accounting degree, the program also provides a broader business perspective necessary for advancement to the highest levels of management. The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in both business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by few other business schools in the world.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in both business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International, an elite distinction shared by few other business schools in the world.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Accounting, Public Accounting, CPA Prep

description: The Lubin MS in Accounting program will provide you with the critical knowledge of accounting principles and business applications to prepare you for a successful career. Our program is designed to create a path for you to become a certified public accountant (CPA). Students who complete the MS in Accounting program will satisfy the 150-credit-hour New York State requirement for CPA licensure and gain the analytical and technical skills that today's top firms and corporations are seeking. As an added benefit, we offer a CPA review course at a significantly reduced price for our graduate accounting students. We offer the accounting program in both New York City and Westchester.
Accreditation status: Pace University's Lubin School of Business is accredited for both business and accounting by AACSB International-The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. This elite distinction is held by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.
Program name: Master of Science in Accounting, Public Accounting, CPA Prep

description: The Master of Science in Applied Artificial Intelligence (MS in AAI) program focuses on giving students a practical understanding of AI technologies and their applications in a variety of industries. Unlike traditional AI master’s programs that emphasize research and theory, this degree focuses on the practical application of AI. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including AI algorithms, natural language processing, deep learning, computer vision, and the development and management of AI projects. The program provides students with real-world problems and data sets, so that they can apply what they learn in class to real-world situations, preparing them for the challenges they will face in their careers. Students will gain the skills necessary to develop AI applications from start to finish, from initial design and data gathering to final deployment and maintenance. Our graduates will be well-prepared to take on positions as AI application developers, AI solution architects, AI project managers, and machine learning engineers, and to drive innovation and growth in their respective industries.
Program name: Master of Science in Applied AI

description:
The Lubin MBA program is designed for business professionals and recent graduates who want to make a difference in their organizations and their communities. We combine the theory, application, and experience students need to become leaders who can create opportunities in a dynamic global business environment. Students develop analytical, practical, and interpersonal skills in a curriculum that gives them a solid foundation in all functional areas of business, as well as the flexibility to specialize in their areas of interest. The program prepares students to become leaders and provides a clear pathway to success and professional growth.

The Arts and Entertainment Management concentration focuses on the business aspects of producing and managing artists, artistic organizations, and events. Students gain comprehensive business expertise with a special focus on businesses that produce and manage artistic events, organizations, and artists in the non-profit and for-profit sectors.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business at Pace University is among the less than 2% of business schools worldwide that are dual accredited by AACSB International—the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business—in both business and accounting.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Arts and Entertainment Management

description: The Master of Science in Arts and Entertainment Management is a 36-credit hour graduate degree that combines business and management theories with industry expertise to prepare students for leadership careers in creative industries. Arts and entertainment organizations are unique cultural enterprises. They face a range of challenges in their efforts to be artistically innovative and financially stable, and to provide stimulating work environments. This program provides students with the critical skills and professional experience needed to meet these challenges.
Program name: Master of Science in Arts and Entertainment Management

description:
The Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence is a 30-credit program that provides students with a comprehensive understanding of AI theory and technologies. Students will learn how to design and build AI systems, apply AI techniques to solve real-world problems, and evaluate the ethical and social implications of AI. The program will prepare students for careers in the rapidly growing field of AI, in roles such as AI researcher, AI engineer, machine learning engineer, and data scientist. The program is offered fully online and asynchronously so students can advance their careers from anywhere in the world.

Program Learning Outcomes
Upon completion of the program, students will be able to:
- Demonstrate knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their applications.
- Design and develop AI systems using a variety of tools and platforms.
- Analyze and interpret data using statistical and machine learning methods.
- Apply ethical principles and professional responsibilities in the development and deployment of AI systems.
- Communicate technical concepts and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Program name: Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence

description: Our Master of Science in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology degree program offers you the laboratory experience and the academic background for a successful career in a wide variety of settings, including biotechnology, pharmaceutical, academic, or government laboratories. The program’s mission is to provide you with a high-quality education in the current theories and techniques of biochemistry and molecular biology in a diverse and nurturing learning environment that prepares students for employment or advanced degree programs.
Program name: Master of Science in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

description: Earn your Juris Doctor (JD) and a Master of Business Administration (MBA) in our highly-regarded joint-degree program. You’ll be uniquely prepared to solve complex challenges at the intersection of law and business, giving you a competitive edge in a wide variety of legal and business fields. Pace University is the only law school in the New York metropolitan area to offer a 4-year joint JD/MBA degree in business. This highly competitive program is a partnership between the Elisabeth Haub School of Law and the Lubin School of Business, both highly respected and nationally-ranked schools. You’ll become a part of our extensive alumni network of more than 8,000 in law and 30,000 in business, many of whom have reached the pinnacle of success in their fields. Benefit from our prime location in the business and legal hub of Westchester County, as well as our proximity to New York City, and access countless opportunities to build the skills you need for a career at the nexus of business and law.
Accreditation status: The Elisabeth Haub School of Law is approved by the Council of the Section of Legal Education and Admissions to the Bar of the American Bar Association (ABA). The Lubin School of Business is dually accredited in business and accounting by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International.
Program name: Master of Business Administration/Juris Doctor in Business Administration

description: The MBA in Business Analytics program provides students with the skills and knowledge to analyze large data sets to make effective business decisions. Students gain a comprehensive understanding of business functional areas and quantitative skills and expertise in various analytical tools. The program is an intensive, 12-18-month program for students with strong quantitative backgrounds. The 39-credit MBA in Business Analytics curriculum provides a solid understanding of business fundamentals along with specialized expertise in business analytics. Our graduates are highly sought after by firms in finance, marketing, and operations. The MBA in Business Analytics program has STEM designation.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business is among the less than three percent of business schools worldwide with dual accreditation from AACSB International—the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business—in both business and accounting.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Business Analytics

description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) program at the Lubin School of Business is an exciting, contemporary, and professional curriculum, combining comprehensive business education with specialized concentrations. The MBA curriculum integrates a global perspective, social responsibility, ethical decision-making, and technology, providing a strong foundation for a variety of roles within the for-profit, non-profit, and public sectors. The curriculum is flexible, offering in-person and online options, and provides in-depth exploration of eight specialized areas of study: accounting, corporate finance, information systems, investment management, marketing management, strategy and international business, talent management, and business (a general track for non-business undergraduates). By utilizing experiential learning techniques such as consulting projects, case studies, field trips, guest speakers, and research projects, Lubin faculty combine theory and practice to enrich the graduate learning experience.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business at Pace University is accredited by AACSB International – The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. AACSB is the premier accrediting organization for business schools in the world. Lubin is dually accredited in both business and accounting, an elite distinction held by fewer than 2% of business schools worldwide.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Business, General

description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) program in Clinical Psychology (Health Care Emphasis) provides students with state-of-the-art training in the science and practice of clinical psychology. This program is a natural outgrowth of the department’s commitment to excellent scientist-practitioner training and is a complement to its well-established PsyD program in School-Clinical Child Psychology. The PhD program offers in-depth training in clinical assessment, diagnosis, and psychotherapy. This training is grounded in an understanding and appreciation of the scientific foundations of psychology. Coursework covers psychological theory, research, and practice in areas such as psychopathology, assessment, psychotherapy, health psychology, neuropsychology, research design, and statistics. Through specialized coursework and practica, students will be prepared to work with individuals with mental disorders in medical and other health care settings. The curriculum satisfies the educational requirements for professional psychology licensure in New York and other states.
Accreditation status: The PhD in Clinical Psychology (Health Care Emphasis) program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of the American Psychological Association (APA).
Program name: Doctor of Philosophy in Clinical Psychology, Health Care Emphasis

description: The Master of Arts in Communications and Digital Media program provides students with the opportunity to acquire sophisticated knowledge about human communication and the skills necessary to succeed in a wide array of communication-related professions in the digital age. This program combines courses in the social sciences and humanities, creating an optimal learning experience for students in an intellectually challenging and professionally relevant curriculum. Our program offers the flexibility of a traditional Master’s program that can be completed entirely online, in-person, or a combination of both. Graduates of this program will be equipped for a broad range of professional positions in private or public sector organizations, as well as for further graduate study leading to a PhD.
Program name: Master of Arts in Communications and Digital Media

description: The Master of Science in Computer Science is a 30-credit program that provides students with high-quality education to advance their professional careers in the field of computer science. Students in this program will have the opportunity to take a wide range of computer science courses from core areas as well as special topics courses representing the latest developments in computer science. Students in this program will acquire knowledge and skills necessary to advance their career in areas such as software engineering, data science, mobile app development, artificial intelligence, cyber security, and other emerging computer science fields. All students must complete the 30-credit program with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0. The program curriculum is comprised of 10 courses that include three core required courses, three elective courses, and a four-course concentration option in a specific subject area.
Program name: Master of Science in Computer Science

description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Computer Science is a research-based degree program that provides students with the opportunity to work at the forefront of computer science and interdisciplinary applications. The program will equip students with the skills needed to pursue research careers in academia or industry. Students in the program develop strong research skills through close mentorship by faculty members, in-depth study of a research area, and active participation in research activities. The Seidenberg School faculty members are active in a wide range of computer science research areas including, artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, human-computer interaction, mobile computing, networking, and security. Students have the opportunity to participate in ongoing research projects, present their work at conferences, and publish their results in journals. The program is committed to providing a supportive and intellectually stimulating environment for students to pursue their research interests. Students work on cutting-edge research in our research labs including the Cybersecurity Lab, the Robotics Lab, the Networking and Data Science Lab, and others.
Program name: Doctor of Philosophy in Computer Science

description: The Master of Science in Cybersecurity program provides students with the advanced knowledge and skills in the various technical and managerial aspects of cybersecurity required to be successful in this field. Students learn offensive and defensive cybersecurity, including how to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities; how to design, implement, and maintain secure systems; and how to manage security policies and procedures. The program prepares students for leadership positions in the cybersecurity field in both the public and private sectors. With a focus on both the theoretical and practical aspects of cybersecurity, students graduate with the skills needed to tackle the most pressing security challenges facing organizations today.
Accreditation status: Pace University has been designated by the National Security Agency and the Department of Homeland Security as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CDE) since 2004.
Program name: Master of Science in Cybersecurity

description: The Master of Science in Data Science program at Pace University will prepare you for a career in the rapidly growing field of data science. You’ll gain a deep understanding of subjects like machine learning, big data analytics, and data visualization. The Seidenberg School’s location in the heart of New York City and its close ties with major companies and organizations will provide you with a multitude of internship and employment opportunities to help you build a solid foundation for your career. The MS in Data Science is a STEM-designated 30-credit program. Data science lies at the intersection of computer science and statistics. This program will offer a balanced and comprehensive curriculum on both sides. Students in this program will learn the latest technologies in big data analytics, machine learning, data mining, and data visualization. Students will have opportunities to work on big data projects using real world data sets in our Big Data Lab. The required capstone project will provide students with opportunities to apply what they have learned to solve real world problems.
Program name: Master of Science in Data Science

description: As the field of homeland security continues to evolve, our society requires educated leaders and managers to protect the American people where they live and work. The fully online Master of Arts in Homeland Security from Pace University provides a unique opportunity for students to become leaders in the intelligence, law enforcement, and emergency management communities. We prepare you to understand and manage complex issues related to security policies, directives, and legal issues, all while helping you develop advanced skills in intelligence, counter-terrorism, consequence management, and inter-agency cooperation. The online homeland security master’s program is a 36-credit degree program taught by faculty who have served in leadership positions in the FBI, U.S. Secret Service, and the Department of Homeland Security, offering a unique opportunity to learn from and network with professionals actively working in the field.
Program name: Master of Arts in Homeland Security

description:
The School of Education offers a Master of Science in Education (MSED) in Literacy Specialist that leads to New York State certification for teachers who already possess initial certification in a related area. The program has two tracks: Birth-Grade 6 and Grades 5-12. Successful completion of the program and passing of the New York State Content Specialty Test in Literacy will lead to professional certification in teaching for candidates who have three years of teaching experience, including one year of literacy teaching experience with a mentor.
Program Goals/Outcomes
Upon completion of the program, students will be able to:
1. Demonstrate knowledge of the foundations of literacy.
2. Use a wide range of instructional practices, approaches, methods, and curriculum materials to support reading and writing instruction.
3. Use a variety of assessment tools and practices to plan and evaluate effective literacy instruction.
4. Create a literate environment that fosters reading and writing by integrating foundational knowledge, instructional practices, and curricular materials.
5. View literacy as a developmental process and implement instruction appropriate to the needs of the emerging, developing, and fluent reader.
Accreditation status: Pace University’s School of Education is nationally accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP).
Program name: Master of Science in Education, Literacy Specialist
Master of Science in Physician Assistant Studies Completion Program

description: The Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Program is a 42-credit Master of Science program for baccalaureate prepared registered nurses. Students are prepared to provide primary psychiatric and mental health care across the lifespan. The program builds on the undergraduate nursing foundation and provides advanced didactic and clinical practice in psychiatric mental health. Graduates are eligible to take the American Nurses Credentialing Center’s (ANCC) national certification examination for Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioners (Across the Lifespan). The PMHNP program is offered in an online format. Students come to campus at the beginning of each clinical course for an on-campus residency which will consist of lab, simulation, and other learning experiences.
Accreditation status: The master's degree program in nursing...at Pace University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).
Program name: Master of Science in Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner Program

Concentration name: Government Management, Healthcare Administration, Nonprofit Management
description: Pace University's Master of Public Administration (MPA) program has been educating and training leaders in public service for over 30 years. Our MPA program prepares students to become leaders who can address society’s most difficult managerial, economic, and social problems. We are looking for students who are committed to a public service career in a variety of fields including government, healthcare, and nonprofit management. The Pace MPA program gives students the necessary skills to effectively manage in this ever-changing environment, with an opportunity for specialization within the field. Students learn to effectively lead and manage organizations, develop and implement policy, and think strategically to anticipate and respond to the myriad challenges facing government and nonprofit organizations. Our accomplished faculty have deep subject matter expertise that they bring to the classroom from professional work as senior government officials, nonprofit executives, and public affairs consultants. Pace University’s MPA program is offered fully online and through a hybrid model that blends online and in-person classes.
Accreditation status: The Master of Public Administration Program is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Public Affairs and Administration (NASPAA), the recognized accrediting body of graduate public administration programs in the United States.
Program name: Master of Public Administration in Public Administration

description: The Master of Public Health (MPH) program is designed to provide graduate, professional education for individuals who seek careers in the field of public health. The program is offered fully online to ensure maximum accessibility to graduate students, working professionals, career changers, and those currently working in the public health or health professions who seek to advance their careers. The curriculum is based on the traditional pillars of public health, which are biostatistics, environmental health sciences, epidemiology, health policy and management, and social and behavioral sciences. Students in the program develop knowledge and skills in these core areas and apply this knowledge to the practice of public health through elective course offerings and the completion of an applied practice experience and a culminating integrated learning experience.
Accreditation status: The Master of Public Health (MPH) program is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH).
Program name: Master of Public Health in Public Health

description: The Master of Science in Publishing is a 36-credit-hour program that combines the study of print and digital media from books and magazines to websites, ebooks, and apps. The program is committed to offering an education that meets the needs of a rapidly changing industry by giving students a strong foundation in both print and digital publishing. In addition to a variety of courses in book and magazine publishing, the program's curriculum includes courses in financial management and business strategies, editing, intellectual property, marketing, websites, ebooks, mobile applications, design, and distribution. Students are encouraged to develop a specialty in either book publishing or magazine publishing. All classes are taught by leading executives in the publishing industry. Graduates go on to work at some of the world's most prestigious publishing houses. And, our location in the media capital of the world—New York City—gives our students the opportunity to learn from the best in the industry and make vital career connections. Publishing students have the chance to serve as staff members of the student-run literary magazine, Aphros, and to work in the publishing office, which produces a nationally distributed book each year.
Program name: Master of Science in Publishing

description: Lead the charge on the latest technologies with a Master of Science in Software Development and Engineering from Pace University’s Seidenberg School of Computer Science and Information Systems. You will develop an in-depth understanding of the concepts and principles of software development and engineering, learn about emerging technologies, and learn to apply this knowledge to real-world problems. The software development and engineering master’s program will provide a path to a career as a software engineer, software developer, enterprise software architect, or team leader through project-based learning. Throughout your coursework, you will have opportunities to engage in the design, development, and testing of complex software systems. In addition to a variety of elective courses, students in the software development and engineering master’s program have the option of pursuing a six-credit master’s thesis.
Program name: Master of Science in Software Development and Engineering

description: The Advanced Certificate in Bilingual Education is for teachers who hold initial or professional certification in a content area or in teaching English to speakers of other languages (TESOL) and who wish to obtain the New York State Bilingual Education Extension. The program provides the candidate with the theoretical and practical knowledge needed to work in a variety of bilingual settings. Candidates will deepen their understanding of cultural, linguistic, and contextual diversity as they work with linguistically diverse students and their families.
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Bilingual Education

description: The Advanced Certificate in Early Childhood Extension Certification (Birth-Grade 2) program is for certified teachers who want to expand their knowledge and expertise to include the education of young children. This 12-credit certificate program is for teachers who hold an initial or professional certificate in Childhood Education (grades 1-6) and wish to obtain an extension certification to teach in early childhood settings (birth-grade 2).
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Early Childhood Extension Certification (Birth-Grade 2)

description: The School of Education offers a 12-credit, fully online, advanced graduate certificate in Integrated Instruction for Literacy and Technology. The curriculum addresses theory, research, and evidence-based practices needed by teachers to integrate technology effectively in K-12 classrooms. Technology is emphasized as a medium for learning across the curriculum for all students.
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Integrated Instruction for Literacy and Technology

Concentration name: English, Mathematics, Social Studies, Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, and Physics
description: The Advanced Certificate in Middle School Extension Certification is available for graduate candidates who hold a Masters Degree and initial certification in Childhood Education 1-6. This certificate extends the grade level for the certification area to include grades 7-9. It is offered for the following content areas: English, Mathematics, Social Studies, Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, and Physics.
Accreditation status: All teacher education, school counseling, and school psychology programs are accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator preparation (AAQEP).
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Middle School Extension Certification

description: The Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Certificate of Advanced Graduate Studies (CAGS) program is designed to prepare master’s and doctorally prepared nurses for advanced practice as a psychiatric mental health nurse practitioner (PMHNP). The CAGS is a non-degree granting program of study that is competency-based, providing core content in psychiatric mental health advanced practice nursing across the lifespan. Emphasis is on assessment and diagnosis of psychiatric disorders and co-morbid conditions; psychopharmacology, individual, group and family psychotherapy; and management of psychiatric disorders of patients across the lifespan. Students complete approximately 500 hours of supervised clinical practice. Upon completion of this program, graduates are eligible for New York State certification as a Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner and are eligible for national board certification by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) as a Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner.
Accreditation status: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and Doctor of Nursing Practice program at Pace University are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.
Program name: Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) Certificate

description: The Secure Software and Information Engineering certificate program is intended for students who wish to specialize in the field of secure software engineering and information security and assurance. The program prepares students to understand the nature of secure software, and how to design, develop, and test such systems. Topics covered in this certificate program include secure software design, analysis, and testing, risk management, data mining for security, software security, network security, and cryptography. Students may complete this certificate program only, or apply these credits toward a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Software Engineering.
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Security and Information Assurance

description: The Advanced Certificate in Software Development and Engineering (SDE) is designed for students who want to become a software engineer with advanced knowledge and practical skills for developing and managing large-scale software systems. This 12-credit graduate certificate offers a fast track to a software engineering career for students with an undergraduate degree in a related field and prior programming experience. The SDE program focuses on core concepts of the entire software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing and maintenance. Students will learn the latest software engineering methodology and gain hands-on experience using modern development tools, techniques and technologies.
Program name: Advanced Certificate in Software Engineering Development

description: The Certificate of Advanced Study (CAS) in Special Education is a 30-36 credit program that prepares candidates to work with students with disabilities from birth-grade 12. Candidates may choose from three specializations: Early Childhood (birth-grade 2), Childhood (grades 1-6), or Adolescence (grades 7-12). This advanced certificate program meets the academic requirements for initial and professional New York State certification in Teaching Students with Disabilities in the area of specialization selected.
Accreditation status: All teacher preparation programs, and school counseling, school psychology, and school-district business leader programs are registered and approved by the New York State Education Department. The teacher preparation programs are also accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Special Education: Teaching Students with Disabilities (All Grades)

description: The Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Teaching English as a Second Language (TESOL) is an 18-credit program for applicants who already possess a master’s degree and are certified teachers. It is designed to extend teachers’ knowledge and skills to include English language learners in K–12 settings. This program of study includes course work and field experience, leading to New York State certification in TESOL. All courses in this program have been approved by the New York State Department of Education.
Accreditation status: All programs leading to licensure in the School of Education are accredited by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP). All courses in this program have been approved by the New York State Department of Education.
Program name: Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Teaching English as a Second Language (TESOL)

description: The Lubin MBA in Business Administration provides students with the critical skills and knowledge necessary to successfully lead and manage organizations in a dynamic global business environment. This degree includes in-depth study in key functional areas of business and a strong emphasis on developing the analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills necessary for effective decision-making and leadership. Students develop practical experience through case analyses, consulting assignments for businesses and not-for-profit organizations, and by participating in programs and centers unique to Lubin, including the Interactive and Direct Marketing (IDM) Lab, the Center for Global Business Programs, and the Center for Student Enterprise. The Lubin MBA is a 39-credit program with eight concentrations: Accounting, Corporate Finance, Information Systems, Investment Management, Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Strategy and International Business, and Talent Management.
Accreditation status: The Lubin School of Business is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International. This is the premier accrediting organization for business schools in the world. Pace University is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education.
Program name: Master of Business Administration in Corporate Finance

description: The Master of Science in Health Informatics prepares students for careers in the healthcare industry. The curriculum provides students with a solid foundation in health informatics. They take courses in data management, analytics and machine learning, security and privacy, UX and usability, mobile applications and systems, and healthcare leadership. They gain the necessary knowledge and skills in information technology and healthcare to support the needs of healthcare organizations.
Program name: Master of Science in Health Informatics

description: The Master of Science (MS) in Human-Centered Design (HCD) at Pace University is a unique interdisciplinary program that bridges the gap between art and information technology. Human-centered design places people at the forefront of the design process to create products, services, systems, and experiences that are not only useful but also usable and desirable. The HCD program provides students with practical research methods and design techniques to understand human needs, behaviors, and motivations. Students learn to conduct user research, analyze data, prototype ideas, and test designs with real users. The curriculum combines hands-on studio work with theoretical coursework, enabling students to develop a strong portfolio and a deep understanding of the principles of human-centered design. Students will learn the essentials of design thinking, user experience (UX) design, interaction design, information architecture, usability testing, and visual design. Graduates of the program will be prepared for careers as UX designers, interaction designers, product designers, user researchers, information architects, and UX strategists in a wide range of industries, including technology, healthcare, finance, and entertainment. The program is suitable for students from diverse backgrounds, including art, design, computer science, psychology, and business. No prior design or programming experience is required.
Program name: Master of Science in Human Centered Design

description: The Master of Science degree in Information Systems is an innovative program that blends management and technology. It is a STEM designated program. Students in the Information Systems master's program can opt for the general MS in IS degree or choose from one of two concentrations: Data Science or User Experience Design. All MS in IS students will learn to formulate and solve business problems by analyzing organizational data, designing data-driven services and products, and managing technology resources. Specifically, the MS in IS program focuses on key data and information management principles, data analytics, IT infrastructure, and data-driven decision making. The program is designed for students with diverse backgrounds, including business, liberal arts and sciences, and computer science. Our graduates are highly sought after by employers because they have a unique blend of business and technology skills. They understand how organizations work, how to identify business opportunities, and how to develop technology-enabled solutions. Information Systems graduates are prepared for careers that are in high demand in today's digital economy, such as business and systems analysts, data scientists, UX designers, technology consultants, and project managers.
Program name: Master of Science in Information Systems

description: The Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy is a 30-credit hour program that provides students with a strong foundation in economic and econometric theory as well as the tools of economic policy analysis. This program is STEM designated. Students will learn the tools necessary to analyze data, assess the impact of public policy, and to communicate the results of their analyses to a wide variety of audiences. The degree provides students with the advanced quantitative and applied research skills needed for careers as economic and policy analysts in the private and public sectors, and in non-profit organizations. Students gain expertise in a variety of software packages, including STATA, SAS, and R. The Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy degree culminates in a semester-long capstone project supervised by a full-time faculty member.
Program name: Master of Science in Applied Quantitative Economic Analysis and Policy

description: The specialization in bilingual school psychology leads to the Master of Science in Education (MSEd) degree in School Psychology and eligibility for New York State certiﬁcation as a School Psychologist and the Bilingual Education Extension to the certiﬁcate. The program prepares graduates to provide a full range of school psychological services for diverse student populations. The program is committed to a multicultural perspective and seeks to recruit a diverse student body. Candidates are prepared as practitioners who can apply psychological principles to educational settings to help resolve learning and behavioral problems in children and adolescents. The program is designed to develop competencies in consultation, assessment, counseling, and research. There is special emphasis on developing multicultural competencies for working in urban schools. Students take a number of specialized courses to develop competence in working with culturally and linguistically diverse children and families and are placed in externship and internship sites with bilingual populations.
Accreditation status: The program is approved by the National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) and registered by the New York State Department of Education.
Program name: Master in Bilingual School Psychology

description: The Master of Science in Education in Childhood Education program is designed for students who have completed an undergraduate or graduate degree in a field other than education and are seeking a master’s degree and initial certification to teach in childhood settings (grades 1–6). Our program has a strong student-teaching component that provides students with numerous opportunities to work with children in a variety of school settings. Students in this program are not required to have a major in a specific content area but must have a broad liberal arts background.
Accreditation status: Pace University’s School of Education is accredited by The Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs. CAEP is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation to accredit programs for the preparation of teachers and other professional school personnel.
Program name: Master in Childhood Education

description: The Master of Science for Teachers (MST) in Childhood Education and TESOL is a 43-credit program that prepares candidates to work with children in grades 1-6 and English language learners in grades K-12. This program is for candidates who have a bachelor's degree in a liberal arts or sciences area, but do not have a teaching degree. The program leads to dual initial certification in Childhood Education and TESOL. Candidates must complete a liberal arts and sciences core of 30 credits and show evidence of college-level study in four areas: artistic expression, communication and humanities, a language other than English, and scientific and mathematical processes. This program is available at both the New York City and Westchester campuses.
Accreditation status: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs.
Program name: Master in Childhood Education and TESOL

Concentration name: Foreign Language, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies, Literacy
description: The School of Education offers a 43-credit program leading to a Master of Science in Teaching (MST) in Childhood and Bilingual Education. The program is specifically designed to meet the needs of those students who do not have an undergraduate degree in teacher education. This program is for individuals holding a baccalaureate degree with a liberal arts or sciences major who have had little or no previous coursework in professional education. Students in this program take a sequence of courses leading to eligibility for New York State certification to teach Childhood Education (grades 1-6) with a Bilingual Extension. All students in this program must also choose an area of concentration in either a Foreign Language, Mathematics, Science, Social Studies or Literacy in order to obtain Initial Certification in Childhood Education and a Bilingual Extension.
Accreditation status: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) for a period of 7 years, from 2020-2027. This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs on both the New York City and Westchester campuses.
Program name: Master in Childhood and Bilingual Education

description: The Master of Science (MS) in Mental Health Counseling degree program is a 60-credit, license-qualifying program that prepares graduates to provide professional counseling services in a wide array of mental health settings. Our program is grounded in a practitioner-scholar model, in which students are guided to base their counseling practice on established theories and evidence-based practices and research. Students will learn the fundamental skills of counseling and psychotherapy and become adept at working with a variety of client populations. The program is designed to meet the academic requirements for licensure as a Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC) in New York State. Through coursework and supervised field experiences, students gain the requisite knowledge and skills to be eligible to apply for a limited permit upon graduation and to begin the process of completing the post-graduate hours necessary to apply for full licensure. The curriculum also has a strong focus on multicultural competence, advocacy, and social justice and how these factors influence the counseling process.
Program name: Master of Science in Mental Health Counseling

description:
The Master of Science for Teachers (MST) in Adolescent Education program is for individuals who hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a specific content area and are looking for an initial certification to teach students in grades 7 through 12. Pace University’s School of Education offers this program in a variety of content areas: biology, chemistry, earth science, English, mathematics, physics, social studies, and Spanish.

Our MST programs blend in-class studies and fieldwork to prepare graduates to be highly effective teachers who promote student learning and development in their chosen content area and grade level. They equip teacher candidates with the skills and dispositions to work with diverse student populations, including students with disabilities and English language learners. Graduates of our MST programs become thoughtful and reflective professionals who are committed to social justice and advocacy.
Accreditation status: The Pace University School of Education is accredited for the continuing accreditation of its educator preparation programs by the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP). The accreditation is for a period of seven years, from July 1, 2021 to June 30, 2028. All of the School of Education’s certification programs are approved by the New York State Education Department.
Program name: Master in Adolescent Education

Concentration name: Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, English, Mathematics, Physics, Social Studies, Spanish
description: The School of Education offers a combined program for graduate students who wish to be certified as a classroom teacher in an academic subject area at the adolescent level (grades 7-12) and as a Teacher of Students with Disabilities at the same level. This program leads to dual initial certification for teaching in public schools in New York State in a subject area (grades 7-12) and as a Teacher of Students with Disabilities (Generalist, grades 7-12). It is a program for individuals who do not hold a teaching certificate. The program prepares teachers for the challenges of today’s diverse classrooms. Coursework focuses on curriculum, instruction and assessment in the context of adolescent development and the specific needs of adolescent students with disabilities. Field experiences are a critical component of the program. Students spend over 150 hours in a variety of school settings observing, and participating in teaching activities before student teaching. Upon successful completion of this program, as well as passing the required New York State teacher certification examinations, students will be recommended for Initial New York State certification in both the subject area and Students with Disabilities. After completing all the requirements for the MST, students in this program may complete a second Master’s degree in Literacy or TESOL.
Accreditation status: The Pace University School of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). This accreditation covers initial teacher preparation programs and advanced educator preparation programs. All Pace University teacher preparation, educational leadership, and school counseling programs are registered and approved by the New York State Education Department (NYSED).
Program name: Master in Adolescent and Adolescent Special Education

description: The School of Education offers a combined MST in Childhood and Childhood Special Education program for students who have completed an undergraduate degree and wish to become certified teachers. Students in this program complete coursework that is fully online or in a blended format, depending on the program. Our MST programs lead to dual certification in both childhood education (grades 1-6) and special education at the childhood level. This program prepares students to work with a diverse student population, including students with disabilities and English language learners. Graduates of the program are prepared to teach in a variety of school settings and are equipped with the skills and knowledge to meet the needs of all students. The curriculum focuses on research-based teaching practices, child development, and the integration of technology in the classroom. Students will also gain hands-on experience through supervised fieldwork and student teaching placements in local schools. Our program provides a supportive and collaborative learning environment where students can develop their teaching skills and build a professional network. Graduates will be well-prepared to make a positive impact on the lives of children and to become leaders in the field of education. Upon completion of the program, students will be eligible for New York State initial certification in both Childhood Education (Grades 1-6) and Students with Disabilities (Grades 1-6). The program is designed to be completed in two years of full-time study, but a part-time option is also available. Graduates will be prepared for a variety of careers in education, including classroom teacher, special education teacher, instructional coordinator, and educational consultant. The program is committed to preparing teachers who are knowledgeable, skilled, and dedicated to meeting the diverse needs of all students. By completing this program, students will be able to create inclusive and effective learning environments for all children, and will have the skills and knowledge to help all students succeed. This MST prepares candidates to be dually certified in Childhood Education and Students with Disabilities (Grades 1-6), allowing them to support a broad range of students. The goal of this MST is to prepare teachers to work in a variety of educational settings, both general education and special education, and to work collaboratively with colleagues and families to ensure student success. The combined program prepares teachers to work with children at a variety of ages and with a range of learning needs.
Accreditation status: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) for a period of 7 years, from 2021-2028. This accreditation covers initial-licensure-level and advanced-level programs. CAEP is a nationally recognized accrediting body for educator preparation.
Program name: Master in Childhood Education and Special Education

Concentration name: Advanced Standing in Early Childhood Development and Learning
Early Childhood Development and Learning with an Annotation in Special Education
description: The Master of Science in Early Childhood Development and Learning is an advanced master’s degree designed for individuals with prior experience and academic background in early childhood education. This program will offer professional educators a deeper and broader understanding of contemporary theory, research, and practice in early childhood education. It offers students the option of focusing their studies in one of two tracks of study: 1. Advanced Standing in Early Childhood Development and Learning or 2. Early Childhood Development and Learning with an Annotation in Special Education. The Advanced Standing in Early Childhood Development and Learning track is for applicants who already possess a bachelor’s or master’s degree in early childhood education. This track allows for a broader choice of electives than the Early Childhood Development and Learning with an Annotation in Special Education track. Both tracks will offer students the opportunity to learn in dynamic, hands-on settings with expert faculty who will guide them in designing, implementing, and evaluating developmentally and culturally-responsive curricula. Graduates of the program will be well prepared for leadership roles in the field as teachers, program directors, instructional coordinators, advocates, and researchers. Please note: This is an advanced degree that does not lead to initial teaching certification.
Accreditation status: The School of Education at Pace University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Program name: Master in Early Childhood Development and Learning

description: The Master of Arts in Early Childhood Development, Learning, and Intervention is a non-certification program that provides students with a strong foundation in typical and atypical child development from birth to grade 2. The program integrates key aspects of development, learning, and instructional intervention for infants, toddlers, preschoolers, and early elementary children. Students are also prepared for careers as specialists or to pursue advanced degrees in child-related professions.
Program name: Master in Early Childhood Development, Learning and Intervention

description: The Master of Arts in Higher Education Administration and Student Affairs (MA in HEASA) is designed for students seeking entry- and mid-level positions in higher education and student affairs administration. The curriculum for the MA in HEASA focuses on providing students with the knowledge, skills, and competencies needed to enter the field and build a career in higher education administration. Throughout the program, students explore the social, cultural, political, and economic contexts of American higher education and examine the ways in which these contexts shape students and their educational experiences. The MA in HEASA is a 30-credit program in which students engage in coursework that includes a six-credit, 300-hour supervised internship. Students explore and apply student and adult development theories, leadership and organizational theories, student affairs functional areas, legal and ethical issues in higher education, and the use of assessment and evaluation in higher education and student affairs. Additionally, students can take elective courses related to their area of professional interest.
Program name: Master of Arts in Higher Education Administration and Student Affairs

description: The 40-credit MS in Education in Literacy and TESOL program leads to dual New York State certification: Literacy Specialist (Birth to Grade 6 and Grades 5 to 12) and Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) (All Grades). It also provides eligibility for TESOL certification in states that have reciprocal agreements with New York. Candidates will gain a comprehensive understanding of language acquisition and literacy development, learn to employ a variety of instructional methods and materials to support emergent and struggling readers in multicultural classrooms, and develop expertise in assessing the strengths and needs of diverse learners and in collaborating with parents, colleagues, and administrators to make a difference in children’s lives.
Program name: Literacy Specialist and TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages)
